docs.snippet: A federal judge ordered the military Tuesday to allow an independent medical evaluation for a hunger-striking Guantanamo prisoner who his lawyers say is in sharply declining health as a result of his protest at the U.S. base in Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge ordered the military Tuesday to allow an independent medical evaluation for a hunger-striking Guantanamo prisoner who his lawyers say is in sharply declining health as a result of his protest at the U.S. base in Cuba.

headline.main: Judge Orders Exam for Guantanamo Hunger Striker
headline.print_headline: Judge Orders Exam for Guantanamo Hunger Striker

docs.snippet: The outcome of Uruguay forward Luis Suarez's appeal against his ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini will be announced on Thursday, the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) said on Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The outcome of Uruguay forward Luis Suarez's appeal against his ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini will be announced on Thursday, the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) said on Wednesday.

headline.main: CAS to Announce Suarez Appeal Verdict on Thursday
headline.print_headline: CAS to Announce Suarez Appeal Verdict on Thursday

docs.snippet: Barcelona forward Luis Suarez was an "accident waiting to happen" at former club Liverpool and the Premier League will be a better place without him, according to league chief Richard Scudamore.
docs.lead_paragraph: Barcelona forward Luis Suarez was an "accident waiting to happen" at former club Liverpool and the Premier League will be a better place without him, according to league chief Richard Scudamore.

headline.main: Suarez 'an Accident Waiting to Happen', Says Scudamore
headline.print_headline: Suarez 'an Accident Waiting to Happen', Says Scudamore

docs.snippet: The southern edge of South America seems an unlikely home for six men who have spent more than a decade locked up without charge at the U.S. base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: The southern edge of South America seems an unlikely home for six men who have spent more than a decade locked up without charge at the U.S. base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

headline.main: From Guantanamo to Uruguay, an Unlikely Journey
headline.print_headline: From Guantanamo to Uruguay, an Unlikely Journey

docs.snippet: In honor of the 27th annual Shark Week, some history about how it all began — even though, according to one analysis, your chances of being bitten by a shark are much slimmer than your chances of being bitten by the Uruguay striker Luis Suárez.
docs.abstract: In honor of the 27th annual Shark Week, some history about how it all began — even though, according to one analysis, your chances of being bitten by a shark are much slimmer than your chances of being bitten by the Uruguay striker Luis Suárez.

headline.main: Throwback Thursday | 1916 New Jersey Shark Attacks

docs.snippet: Uruguay forward Luis Suarez's four-month playing ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini has been upheld by the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) although he will be allowed train with his new club Barcelona.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay forward Luis Suarez's four-month playing ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini has been upheld by the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) although he will be allowed train with his new club Barcelona.

headline.main: Suarez Biting Bans Upheld but He Can Train With Barca
headline.print_headline: Suarez Biting Bans Upheld but He Can Train With Barca

docs.snippet: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) released the following statement on Thursday regarding the case of Uruguay striker Luis Suarez who bit an opponent during a World Cup match in June.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) released the following statement on Thursday regarding the case of Uruguay striker Luis Suarez who bit an opponent during a World Cup match in June.

headline.main: CAS Statement on Luis Suarez Biting Case
headline.print_headline: CAS Statement on Luis Suarez Biting Case

docs.snippet: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) said on Thursday that Uruguay forward Luis Suarez had lost his appeal against his four-month ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match. He will, however, be allowed to train with...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) said on Thursday that Uruguay forward Luis Suarez had lost his appeal against his four-month ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match. He will, however, be allowed to train with his new club Barcelona.

headline.main: FACTBOX: Luis Suarez's Sins and Sanctions
headline.print_headline: FACTBOX: Luis Suarez's Sins and Sanctions

docs.snippet: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) said on Thursday that Uruguay forward Luis Suarez had lost his appeal against his four-month ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match. He will, however, be allowed to train with...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) said on Thursday that Uruguay forward Luis Suarez had lost his appeal against his four-month ban for biting Italy defender Giorgio Chiellini during a World Cup match. He will, however, be allowed to train with his new club Barcelona.
